title: Invygo
html:
Overview

Established in 2018 and headquartered in Dubai, Invygo is the first car subscription start-up in the MENA region. I first joined the project in the idea phase and took the challenge to build the first viable product in just 1 month.

  • Website: https://www.invygo.com/
  • iOS: https://apps.apple.com/ae/app/invygo-car-rental-made-easy/id1445676307
  • Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.invygo.customer&hl=en&gl=US

Role

As a freelance technical architect, I worked on the project from idea to the first visible product with one in-house developer in just 1 month and we got the first customer in just 1 week after. I worked for Invygo in 2 years.

My primary responsibilities were managing the mobile application, enhance the backend architecture and contribute the technical solution to scale our system. I also support to build the backbone for data analytics and marketing automation system based on adjust, mixpanel, customer.io, and in-house data in MongoDB.

Besides that, I also contributed product ideas to improve business growth.

Outstanding numbers during my time

  • From idea to minimum viable product in just 1 month (with online payment gateway as well).
  • Raised more than $2M in funding and going to get the Series A.
  • Top 15 travel apps in UAE.
  • Has more than 50k users.
  • Expanded to Saudi Arabia and going to expand more.

Outstanding solutions and technologies

  • In-house Referral system
  • Mobile OCR with ML Kit
  • Online payment with Checkout
  • Data analytics and marketing automation system with adjust, mixpanel, customer.io, and in-house data in MongoDB
  • Event-driven architecture With RabbitMQ
  • Micro-services with gRPC protocol
  • The backend was built by hapijs and uses MongoDB for the main database
  • The cross-platform mobile app with React Native
  • Mobile A/B Testing and Feature Flag with Firebase
  • CI/CD with fastlane, Bitrise for mobile and Jenkins for backend, web front-end
  • Automation testing with Selenium, Appium
  • System monitoring with Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana
  • Mobile monitoring with Bugsnag and Firebase Crashlytics
  • And more features such as Maps, Places API, Push Notification, Deep linking, etc
custom_excerpt: Dubai car subscription start-up helps you to get a car without the headaches
excerpt: Dubai car subscription start-up helps you to get a car without the headaches

title: Active For Good
html:
Overview

Active For Good was started in 2009 by the founders of MANA Nutrition, a non-profit organization that manufactures life-saving packets of RUTF (Ready to Use Therapeutic Food) to prevent childhood deaths caused by severe acute malnutrition. Active For Good inspiring people to get active and healthy while unlocking more packets for kids who need them most.

  • Website: https://activeforgood.com/
  • iOS: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/calorie-cloud/id1140341868?ls=1
  • Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.caloriecloud.android&hl=en

Role

When I joined the project, we have the mobile app already but most of the parts were written on the native side by Swift and Java. So the first challenge that I need to enhance the bridge between the native side and the javascript side so we can write more UI features on the React Native.

I contribute mainly to the mobile app in 2 years and start working with the backend side after that.

Outstanding numbers during my time

  • The Javascript code coverage was increased from 30% to 80%
  • Lifes saved was increased from 10,000 to 22,000+ children
  • People active was increased from 200,000 to 400,000+ people
  • Packets donated was increased from 1,5M to 3,5M

Outstanding solutions and technologies

  • Health management with Google Fit, HealthKit, Garmin Connect, Fitbit
  • The backend was built by ExpressJS and uses MongoDB for the main database
  • The cross-platform mobile app with React Native, Swift 5 and Java.
  • CI/CD with fastlane for mobile and Heroku CI for backend.
  • Mobile monitoring with Sentry and Firebase Crashlytics
  • And more features such as WebView, Push Notification, Deep linking, Animations, etc
custom_excerpt: Helping people get active and healthy while serving a great cause.
excerpt: Helping people get active and healthy while serving a great cause.

title: LittleLives
html:
Overview

Established in 2011 and headquartered in Singapore, LittleLives is the leading The leading school management system in the education industry. LittleLives is available in more than 26 cities in 10 countries and using by over 1000 schools.

  • Website: https://www.littlelives.com/

Role

I joined LittleLives as a freelancer and worked mainly on the Start Small Dream Big product in 2 months. After that, I continue in next 2 years as the Technical Leader on the backend side with Elixir, built Six UI Components - the VueJS front-end framework, also worked on the internal communication platform in ReactJS.

Outstanding numbers during my time

  • Start Small Dream Big project was using by over 300 schools with 1000+ teachers and 5000+ parents.
  • Internal Communication Platform became the main communication tool between LittleLives, Schools, Teachers and Parents.
  • Helps the Vietnam business team to explore the Vietnam market and grow the schools from 0 to 30+ schools.

Outstanding solutions and technologies

  • Built Start Small Dream Big from scratch with Elixir (Phoenix) & React Native.
  • Built the Six UI Components framework from scratch and it has been used in at least 3 internal products.
  • Built the internal communication platform from scratch (https://youtu.be/mBke0uPMJDM)
  • Built the Flick-like uploader in ReactJS from scratch (https://youtu.be/Lux4sLpAcGc)
  • The Medium-like rich text editor on React Native (https://youtu.be/fLVwYG0uiGg)
custom_excerpt:
The leading school management system
in the education industry
excerpt:
The leading school management system
in the education industry

title: Yojee
html:
Overview

Established in 2010 and headquartered in Singapore, Yojee is the best-in-class logistics software that utilizes Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning to optimize and manage delivery operations. The company raised more than A$ 17.1M. I worked mainly on mobile apps with React Native.

  • Website: https://yojee.com/

Role

I'm the main mobile developer and lead other in-house developers to deliver mobile apps for the business customer. As you know, Yojee provides a solution platform where other companies can customize to serve their logistics business. So we need to customize the mobile app with different looks and feels and features for each client.

Outstanding numbers during my time

  • Customized different label app for 10 clients.
  • Enhance the performance of the app, it's 50% faster than the old. I have the review result in the beginning (Note: some contents may out of date at this time): https://docs.google.com/document/d/1I7rAqiqR94gO5cEZ5mxaO2gEO0M49Z_kR6RfsudKP-w/edit

Outstanding solutions and technologies

  • Real-time location based
  • Rich Maps and Places API
  • In-house feature flags for different clients.
  • One source code but can bundle for different clients.
  • CI/CD with fastlane, Bitrise for mobile and Jenkins for backend, web front-end
  • Automation testing with Selenium, Appium
  • Mobile monitoring with Bugsnag and Firebase Crashlytics
  • And more features Push Notification, Deep linking, etc
custom_excerpt: Yojee’s best-in-class logistics software utilises Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning to optimise and manage delivery operations
excerpt: Yojee’s best-in-class logistics software utilises Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning to optimise and manage delivery operations

title: Feedlestack
html:
Overview

Established in 2019 and headquartered in Paris, Feedlestack helps to collect the last feed tech professionals would ever need. By showing our users great content, we want to empower them to learn on a lifelong basis, to establish credibility in front of coworkers, partners and clients, or to build their personal brand. I worked on front-end stuffs (the mobile app, the landing page and the web app)

  • Website: https://feedlestack.com/
  • iOS: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/feedlestack/id1493409773?ls=1
  • Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.feedlestack.mobile&hl=en

Role

When I joined Feedlestack, we have the web app and the mobile app already. My works that improve their architecture, apply the new design and work with the team to design the subscription payment flow.

Outstanding solutions and technologies

  • Subscription payment with Chargebee
  • Authentication with Auth0
  • Twitter API
  • Web View in the React Native
  • Webflow

title: Petro Ninja
html:
Overview

Established in 2014 and headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Petro Ninja helps more than 10,000 energy professionals access oil and gas data in a powerful web based platform. Use Petro Ninja's powerful web tools to extract well information, forecast production and create reports. Harness Petro Ninja's collaboration functionality across business units and the entire organization. Synchronize vital operations data and make informed decisions faster. I worked mainly on the mobile app in more than 1 year.

  • Website: https://petroninja.com/
  • iOS: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/petro-ninja/id1208288818
  • Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.petroninja&hl=en_NZ

Role

When joined, I forked the react-native-mapbox to fix fix some native issues, also write the unit tests. After that I helped enhancing the mobile app with more beautiful charts for oil industry.

Outstanding solutions and technologies

  • Mapbox
  • Oil industry data
  • Beautiful charts
custom_excerpt: Open Data for the Oil and Gas Industry
excerpt: Open Data for the Oil and Gas Industry
